DataElement.preferredName: Over the Counter Product Fluoride Use Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor"s order or prescription. A chemical that helps prevent tooth decay.  Fluoride may be present in drinking water or applied to the teeth. Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose. A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Fluoride may be present in drinking water or applied to the teeth. Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor's order or prescription.:A chemical that helps prevent tooth decay.  Fluoride may be present in drinking water or applied to the teeth.

Concepts.definition: A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor's order or prescription.

Considered a trace element, fluoride is any combination of elements containing the fluorine atom in the -1 oxidation state (fluoride ion).  Due to its reactivity, fluorine is found in nature as fluorine compounds or fluorides.  Fluoride inhibits various enzyme systems, erythrocyte glycolysis and binds Ca++, causing anticoagulation and other toxic effects.  In addition, fluoride is a mitogen for osteoblasts and stimulates bone formation. (NCI)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you use fluoride products,
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you use fluoride products, other than over-the-counter fluoride toothpaste? (such as fluoride mouth rinse or mouthwash)
